alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A Cluster of Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, west central Clarendon, southwestern Sumter, northeastern Orangeburg and southeastern Richland Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Eastover to near St. Matthews. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... St. Matthews, Eastover, Elloree, Gadsden, Santee State Park, Poinsett State Park, Santee, Pinewood, Cameron, Paxville, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, St. Paul, Fort Motte, Stumphole Landing, Creston, Lone Star and Low Falls Landing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 136 and 139. Interstate 95 near mile marker 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Marion, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
